title: What did every home have in 1920 that no one (or most) doesn't have in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are many; landline telephone with rotary dials, party lines, coal bins, Ice box for the chunk of ice delivered by the “Ice man”, clothes lines and clothes props, curtain stretchers, treadle sewing machines, percolators for making coffee, tea sets for entertaining, areas for hanging washed clothes in the winter in the house, coal furnace, washing machines with rollers in the top to squeeze out water.

A washing machine with a mangle or wringer. Either electric or crank powered pressure rolls for squeezing rinse water out of the washing to speed air drying. Great care had to be exercised to avoid getting fingers or protruding body parts from being pulled through with the washed clothing. (As the saying went… Don't get your tit caught in the wringer..)
